title: Modern GIS with Python: Beyond the Desktop

title: Welcome To My Academic Blog
text:
Welcome to the Spatial Geography Hub
Welcome to my updated personal website and blog! I am thrilled to share my journey as a geographer and spatial data scientist with a global community of researchers and developers.
This blog will serve as a space for: - Tutorials: Deep dives into Google Earth Engine, Python, and R for geospatial analysis. - Project Updates: Behind-the-scenes looks at the development of my innovations like geeadvance and deepgee. - Field Notes: Insights from workshops, research conventions, and academic fieldwork.
Since this is a platform for geographers, expect to see a lot of satellite imagery, code snippets, and spatial insights. Whether you are a student just starting with GIS or a professional looking for advanced AI-driven spatial tools, I hope you find this content valuable.
Feel free to leave comments using your GitHub account‚ÄîI look forward to engaging in technical discussions and collaborations!

title: Pulakesh Pradhan
text:
LinkedIn  Github  Scholar  YouTube  Email






I am a Geographer and Spatial Data Scientist specialized in GIS and Remote Sensing. My work focuses on leveraging Google Earth Engine (GEE), Machine Learning, and Cloud Computing to solve complex environmental and spatial problems.
Currently, I am exploring the fusion of Artificial Intelligence with Earth Observation data to improve agricultural monitoring and disaster management. I am passionate about open-source development and have created several Python packages to simplify GEE workflows for the research community.

View full CV ‚Üí

title: Publications
text:
Modern Cartography Series ‚Ä¢ 2024
This study analyzes agricultural drought in Paschim Medinipur, West Bengal, using Google Earth Engine with satellite and climate datasets from 2002‚Äì2022. It assesses precipitation variability, drought indices, and climate trends.
DOI Link Download PDF



 GEE and AI for Earth Observation ‚Ä¢ 2025
This study demonstrates the use of AHP in Google Earth Engine to identify vulnerable areas for flood hazards in Odisha. Key parameters include elevation, rainfall, land cover, and TWI.
ResearchGate Download PDF
